description: This walk runs through the beautiful Sirhowy Valley in south Wales. The trail starts at the delightful Tredegar House Country Park near Newport. Here you will find a 17th-century mansion surrounded by 90 acres of beautiful gardens and parkland. The trail then heads north towards Risca and Blackwood before finishing at Tredegar. Highlights on the walk include waterside sections along the Monmouthshire and Brecon Canal near Newport and along the Sirhowy river through Blackwood. You also visit the pretty Sirhowy Valley Country Park at Risca. Here you can enjoy climb to Machen Mountain where there are spectacular views of the Rhymney Valley and Sirhowy Valley, Cardiff and the Bristol Channel. The walk is waymarked with yellow arrow on a white disc.
